text.div:
Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide ihe.iti.vhl

IHE_ITI_VHL

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/VHL/ImplementationGuide/ihe.iti.vhl

Patient Mediated sharing of their health information using internet accessible verifiable health link.

ImplementationGuide-iheitivhl.name: IHE_ITI_VHL
ImplementationGuide-iheitivhl.title: Verified Health Link
ImplementationGuide-iheitivhl.description: Patient Mediated sharing of their health information using internet accessible verifiable health link.

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

resource.name: Accept mTLS
resource.description: Accept an mTLS in order to conduct further transactions under a secure channel

resource.name: Audit Event - Accessed Health Data
resource.description:
Record an event for audit purpose related to the issuance of a VHL.

In this option the VHL Sharer records an audit event for critical events in the access of health documents including:
* Request for the generation of a VHL by a VHL Holder; and
* Request for access to a (set of) health document(s) by a VHL Receiver.

resource.name: Audit Event - Received Health Data
resource.description:
Record an event for audit purpose related to the issuance of a VHL.

In this option the VHL Receiver records an audit event for critical events in the access of health documents, for example, including:
* provisioning of VHL from a Holder
* retrieval of health data from the a VHL Sharer

resource.name: Create Trusted Channel
resource.description: Accept an mTLS in order to conduct further transactions under a secure channel

resource.name: Distribute PKI material
resource.description: Make received trust material available through a distribution point to a VHL Sharer or VHL Receiver

resource.name: Establish Trust
resource.description: Establish a trust relationship as participants in a trust network

resource.name: Generate VHL
resource.description:
Generate a VHL to issue to a Holder.

This transactions is used by a VHL Holder to request that a VHL Sharer generate a VHL.  A VHL Sharer may optionally record the consent of the individual to share their information under the Record Consent option. A VHL Sharer may optionally create an audit trail of the creation of the VHL under the Audit Event option. The individual shall trust that VHL Sharer has been authorized by its jurisidiction to authorize and provide access to health documents.   

For more details see the detailed [transaction description](volume-2.html#GenerateVHL)

resource.name: Initiate mTLS
resource.description: Initiate an mTLS in order to conduct further transactions under a secure channel

resource.name: Provide VHL
resource.description: This transacation is initiated by a VHL Holder to transmit a VHL to the VHL Receiver.   Depending on the use case and context, the payload comprising the VHL may be rendered/serialized and transmitted through various mechanisms, for example as a QR-code, Verifiable Credentials, bluetooth or near-field communication protocols.  These mechanisms are described in [Volume 3](volume-3.html). For more details see the detailed [transaction description](ITI-YY4.html)

resource.name: Publish PKI material
resource.description: Publish trust material to a Trust Anchor

resource.name: Receive PKI material
resource.description: Receive trust material from a VHL Sharer or VHL Receiver, as trust network participants, for distribution within the Trust Network

resource.name: Receive VHL
resource.description: Is able to receive a VHL authorization mechanism from a VHL Holder

resource.name: Record Consent
resource.description:
Record the consent given by the Holder for the creation and utilization of the VHL.

In this option the VHL Sharer acts a Consent Recorder from the Privacy Consent on FHIR (PCF) profile.  In this option, the VHL Sharer SHALL initiate a [Access Consent : ITI-108)(https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/PCF/ITI-108.html)
transaction as part of the Expected Actions after receipt of a Generate VHL request.   The Access Consent transaction is used to record the consent declarations by the VHL Holder for the sharing of the (set of) health document(s) by the VHL Sharer to any authorized VHL Receiver within the trust network for a specified use case.

resource.name: RecordAccessToHealthData
resource.description: Record an event for audit purpose related to the access of health data such as when, which enitity or natural person, ehich data was accessed.

resource.name: Request VHL Document
resource.description: This  transaction is initiated by a VHL Receiver to request a single health document from a VHL Sharer.  This transaction should be conducted in such a manner that the VHL Receiver and VHL Sharer can validate their respective participation in the same trust network.  The VHL Receiver shall optionally be able to validate that the veracity of the health document received through this transaction under the Verify Document Signature option.  The VHL Sharer shall optionally be able to record an audit event for the access of the folder by the VHL Receiver upon the transaction request under the Audit Event option. For more details see the detailed [transaction description](ITI-YY4.html)

resource.name: Request VHL Documents
resource.description:
This transactions is initiated by a VHL Receiver to request a set of health documents from a VHL Sharer.  This transaction should be conducted in such a manner that the VHL Receiver and VHL Sharer can validate one another's participation in the same trust network. The VHL Sharer shall optionally be able to record an audit event for the access of the folder by the VHL Receiver upon the transaction request under the Audit Event option.


For more details see the detailed [transaction description](ITI-YY4.html)

resource.name: Retrieve PKI material
resource.description: Retrieve PKI material from a distribution point

resource.name: Trust Anchor
resource.description: Trust Anchor

resource.name: VerifyDocumentSignature
resource.description:
In this option the VHL Receiver, after receipt of a digitally signed document from a VHL Sharer, shall verify the digtial signature using previosuly retrieved PKI material.  This key material may or may not be distributed under the same trust network under which the VHL was distributed.  This key material may or may not be the same key material that was used to verify the VHL.

See cross-profile considerations for a discussion of the relationship of this option to the IHE Document Signature profile.

resource.name: VHL Holder
resource.description: VHL Holder

resource.name: VHL Receiver
resource.description: VHL Receiver

resource.name: VHL Sharer
resource.description: VHL Sharer

Generated Narrative: Requirements CreateTrustedChannel

  • VHL Receiver
  • VHL Sharer

These requirements derive from Establish Trust

extension.valueMarkdown: Accept an mTLS in order to conduct further transactions under a secure channel

text.div:
Generated Narrative: Requirements DistributePKIMaterial

These requirements apply to the actor Trust Anchor

These requirements derive from Establish Trust

Receive PKI distribution request

Receive a PKI distribution request from a trust network participant.

Assemble Trust List

Assemble, if not previously done so, the necessary PKI material for distribution as part of a trust list. Distribution of PKI material should allow for the categorization of PKI material such as by participant, by key usage type, and usage/business context.

Assemble PKI Material

Assemble PKI material for distribution as part of a trust list. Distribution of PKI material should allow for the categorization of PKI material such as by participant, by key usage type, and usage/business context.

Sign trust list

Sign the trust list of PKI material using the private key of the Trust Anchor.

Distribute signed PKI Material

Distribute the signed key material in response to the request from a trust network participant.

extension.valueMarkdown: Make received trust material available through a distribution point to a VHL Sharer or VHL Receiver
Receive a PKI distribution request from a trust network participant.

Assemble, if not previously done so, the necessary PKI material for distribution as part of a trust list. Distribution of PKI material should allow for the categorization of PKI material such as by participant, by key usage type, and usage/business context.

Assemble PKI material for distribution as part of a trust list. Distribution of PKI material should allow for the categorization of PKI material such as by participant, by key usage type, and usage/business context.
Sign the trust list of PKI material using the private key of the Trust Anchor.
Distribute the signed key material in response to the request from a trust network participant.

text.div:
Generated Narrative: Requirements PublishPKIMaterial

These requirements apply to the following actors:

  • VHL Sharer
  • VHL Receiver

These requirements derive from Establish Trust

Generate Private-Public Key Pair

Generate one or more sets of private-public key pair for usage within a trust network. The key pairs may be categorized in one or more ways. For example, categories could include key usage type (e.g. signatures, encryption, mTLS) or by use contest / business domain.

Create Trust List

Create a trust list of the PKI material from the key pairs including any necessary data needed for categorization of PKImaterial.

Publish Trust List

Publish the trust list of created PKI material to the Trust Anchor for distribution among the trust network participants.

extension.valueMarkdown: Publish trust material to a Trust Anchor

Generate one or more sets of private-public key pair for usage within a trust network.  The key pairs may be categorized in one or more ways.  For example, categories could include key usage type (e.g. signatures, encryption, mTLS) or by use contest / business domain.
Create a trust list of the PKI material from the key pairs including any necessary data needed for categorization of PKImaterial.
Publish the trust list of created PKI material to the Trust Anchor for distribution among the trust network participants.

text.div:
Generated Narrative: Requirements ReceivePKIMaterial

These requirements apply to the actor Trust Anchor

These requirements derive from Establish Trust

Validate Trust List

Perform any necessary validations of the trust list according to the jurisidictional policy under which the Trust Anchor is operating, Validation may include enforcing, for example the governance of cryptographic algorithms used material, expiry times, or the presence of certificate chains back to certificate authorities.

extension.valueMarkdown: Receive trust material from a VHL Sharer or VHL Receiver, as trust network participants, for distribution within the Trust Network

Perform any necessary validations of the trust list according to the jurisidictional policy under which the Trust Anchor is operating,  Validation may include enforcing, for example the governance of cryptographic algorithms used material, expiry times, or the presence of certificate chains back to certificate authorities.

ImplementationGuide/ihe.iti.vhl.name: IHE_ITI_VHL
ImplementationGuide/ihe.iti.vhl.title: Verified Health Link
ImplementationGuide/ihe.iti.vhl.description: Patient Mediated sharing of their health information using internet accessible verifiable health link.

Requirements/AcceptMTLSConnection.name: AcceptMTLSConnection
Requirements/AcceptMTLSConnection.title: Accept mTLS
Requirements/AcceptMTLSConnection.description: Accept an mTLS in order to conduct further transactions under a secure channel

Requirements/AuditEventAccess.name: AuditEvent
Requirements/AuditEventAccess.title: Audit Event - Accessed Health Data
Requirements/AuditEventAccess.description:
Record an event for audit purpose related to the issuance of a VHL.

In this option the VHL Sharer records an audit event for critical events in the access of health documents including:
* Request for the generation of a VHL by a VHL Holder; and
* Request for access to a (set of) health document(s) by a VHL Receiver.

Requirements/AuditEventReceived.name: AuditEventReceived
Requirements/AuditEventReceived.title: Audit Event - Received Health Data
Requirements/AuditEventReceived.description:
Record an event for audit purpose related to the issuance of a VHL.

In this option the VHL Receiver records an audit event for critical events in the access of health documents, for example, including:
* provisioning of VHL from a Holder
* retrieval of health data from the a VHL Sharer

Requirements/CreateTrustedChannel.name: CreateTrustedChannel
Requirements/CreateTrustedChannel.title: Create Trusted Channel
Requirements/CreateTrustedChannel.description: Accept an mTLS in order to conduct further transactions under a secure channel

Requirements/DistributePKIMaterial.name: DistributePKIMaterial
Requirements/DistributePKIMaterial.title: Distribute PKI material
Requirements/DistributePKIMaterial.description: Make received trust material available through a distribution point to a VHL Sharer or VHL Receiver

Requirements/EstablishTrust.name: EstablishTrust
Requirements/EstablishTrust.title: Establish Trust
Requirements/EstablishTrust.description: Establish a trust relationship as participants in a trust network

Requirements/GenerateVHL.name: GenerateVHL
Requirements/GenerateVHL.title: Generate VHL
Requirements/GenerateVHL.description:
Generate a VHL to issue to a Holder.

This transactions is used by a VHL Holder to request that a VHL Sharer generate a VHL.  A VHL Sharer may optionally record the consent of the individual to share their information under the Record Consent option. A VHL Sharer may optionally create an audit trail of the creation of the VHL under the Audit Event option. The individual shall trust that VHL Sharer has been authorized by its jurisidiction to authorize and provide access to health documents.   

For more details see the detailed [transaction description](volume-2.html#GenerateVHL)

Requirements/InitiateMTLSConnection.name: InitiateMTLSConnection
Requirements/InitiateMTLSConnection.title: Initiate mTLS
Requirements/InitiateMTLSConnection.description: Initiate an mTLS in order to conduct further transactions under a secure channel

Requirements/ProvideVHL.name: ProvideVHL
Requirements/ProvideVHL.title: Provide VHL
Requirements/ProvideVHL.description: This transacation is initiated by a VHL Holder to transmit a VHL to the VHL Receiver.   Depending on the use case and context, the payload comprising the VHL may be rendered/serialized and transmitted through various mechanisms, for example as a QR-code, Verifiable Credentials, bluetooth or near-field communication protocols.  These mechanisms are described in [Volume 3](volume-3.html). For more details see the detailed [transaction description](ITI-YY4.html)

Requirements/PublishPKIMaterial.name: PublishPKIMaterial
Requirements/PublishPKIMaterial.title: Publish PKI material
Requirements/PublishPKIMaterial.description: Publish trust material to a Trust Anchor

Requirements/ReceivePKIMaterial.name: ReceivePKIMaterial
Requirements/ReceivePKIMaterial.title: Receive PKI material
Requirements/ReceivePKIMaterial.description: Receive trust material from a VHL Sharer or VHL Receiver, as trust network participants, for distribution within the Trust Network

Requirements/ReceiveVHL.name: ReceiveVHL
Requirements/ReceiveVHL.title: Receive VHL
Requirements/ReceiveVHL.description: Is able to receive a VHL authorization mechanism from a VHL Holder

Requirements/RecordAccessToHealthData.name: RecordAccessToHealthData
Requirements/RecordAccessToHealthData.title: RecordAccessToHealthData
Requirements/RecordAccessToHealthData.description: Record an event for audit purpose related to the access of health data such as when, which enitity or natural person, ehich data was accessed.

Requirements/RecordConsent.name: RecordConsent
Requirements/RecordConsent.title: Record Consent
Requirements/RecordConsent.description:
Record the consent given by the Holder for the creation and utilization of the VHL.

In this option the VHL Sharer acts a Consent Recorder from the Privacy Consent on FHIR (PCF) profile.  In this option, the VHL Sharer SHALL initiate a [Access Consent : ITI-108)(https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/PCF/ITI-108.html)
transaction as part of the Expected Actions after receipt of a Generate VHL request.   The Access Consent transaction is used to record the consent declarations by the VHL Holder for the sharing of the (set of) health document(s) by the VHL Sharer to any authorized VHL Receiver within the trust network for a specified use case.

Requirements/RequestVHLDocument.name: RequestVHLDocument
Requirements/RequestVHLDocument.title: Request VHL Document
Requirements/RequestVHLDocument.description: This  transaction is initiated by a VHL Receiver to request a single health document from a VHL Sharer.  This transaction should be conducted in such a manner that the VHL Receiver and VHL Sharer can validate their respective participation in the same trust network.  The VHL Receiver shall optionally be able to validate that the veracity of the health document received through this transaction under the Verify Document Signature option.  The VHL Sharer shall optionally be able to record an audit event for the access of the folder by the VHL Receiver upon the transaction request under the Audit Event option. For more details see the detailed [transaction description](ITI-YY4.html)

Requirements/RequestVHLDocuments.name: RequestVHLDocuments
Requirements/RequestVHLDocuments.title: Request VHL Documents
Requirements/RequestVHLDocuments.description:
This transactions is initiated by a VHL Receiver to request a set of health documents from a VHL Sharer.  This transaction should be conducted in such a manner that the VHL Receiver and VHL Sharer can validate one another's participation in the same trust network. The VHL Sharer shall optionally be able to record an audit event for the access of the folder by the VHL Receiver upon the transaction request under the Audit Event option.


For more details see the detailed [transaction description](ITI-YY4.html)

Requirements/RetrievePKIMaterial.name: RetrievePKIMaterial
Requirements/RetrievePKIMaterial.title: Retrieve PKI material
Requirements/RetrievePKIMaterial.description: Retrieve PKI material from a distribution point

Requirements/VerifyDocumentSignature.name: VerifyDocumentSignature
Requirements/VerifyDocumentSignature.title: VerifyDocumentSignature
Requirements/VerifyDocumentSignature.description:
In this option the VHL Receiver, after receipt of a digitally signed document from a VHL Sharer, shall verify the digtial signature using previosuly retrieved PKI material.  This key material may or may not be distributed under the same trust network under which the VHL was distributed.  This key material may or may not be the same key material that was used to verify the VHL.

See cross-profile considerations for a discussion of the relationship of this option to the IHE Document Signature profile.
